intro: Dialium graciliflorum, commonly known as slender-flowered African olive, is a tropical tree native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically harvested when they turn yellow or red. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally in various medicinal applications. The tree is often found in moist lowland forests and thrives in warm, humid climates.
